result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's response to defense motion to suppress, filed.
Defense Motion to Suppress - Unconstitutional Warrantless Search of Home, filed.

Defendant Osceola John Spychala appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Osceola John Spychala.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a motion hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.22.2022, filed.

Defendant Osceola John Spychala appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Osceola John Spychala.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Court adjourns matter for an additional Scheduling Conference to Br 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (18 pages) commencing 07-29-22 by EMILY REBEK.

BR 10 ON BEHALF OF BR 29.
Defendant Osceola John Spychala in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee police officer Jacob Bryant- Povletich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-29-22, filed.
Case set for a preliminary hearing on 7/29/22 at 9:00 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Branch 10 has agreed to hear the case for Branch 29. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Osceola John Spychala in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-8-22, filed.

Defendant Osceola John Spychala in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn, as a friend of the court.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Attorney McGinn provides an update to the Court. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-10-22, filed.
of expert testimony and intent to use DNA, filed.

Defendant Osceola John Spychala in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEARED BY VIDEO.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
22RM017726  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 04-01-2022
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 4-6-2022, filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LEG (1/28/82)

Defendant Osceola John Spychala in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Osceola John Spychala in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Osceola John Spychala appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
